channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Biden Looks to Raise Taxes on Wealthy and Corporations to Shave Deficit
item.description: Lael Brainard, the director of the National Economic Council, said lawmakers should raise taxes on companies and the wealthiest while extending the 2017 cuts for those making less than $400,000.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: More People Flee Rafah as Fears Rise of Full-Scale Invasion
item.description: Three days after an Israeli evacuation warning, Palestinians were leaving the southern Gaza city for uncertain “safe zones” in cars, trucks and donkey carts.

item.title: Target's Pride Month presence will be subdued in 2024 after last year's protests
item.description: Company says it will carry merchandise only in “select stores”.

item.title: Satellite Images Reveal Where Russian Nuclear Weapons Could Be Stored in Belarus
item.description: A New York Times analysis shows security upgrades unique to Russian nuclear storage facilities, at a Cold War-era munitions depot.

item.title: From Ancient Charcoal, Hints of Wildfires to Come
item.description: By digging into the geologic record, scientists are learning how wildfires shaped — and were shaped by — climate change long ago.

item.title: Bumble founder says your dating 'AI concierge' will soon date hundreds of other people's 'concierges' for you
item.description: Bumble is now navigating itself in a world of AI—which means rethinking how humans will interact with each other in an increasing age of chatbots.

item.title: Schools in One Virginia County to Reinstate Confederate Names
item.description: The school board voted on Friday to reverse a decision made four years ago, when the killing of George Floyd prompted nationwide demands for a racial reckoning, to rename the schools.

item.title: Satellite Images Reveal Where Russian Nuclear Weapons Could Be Stored in Belarus
item.description: A New York Times analysis shows security upgrades unique to Russian nuclear storage facilities, at a Cold War-era munitions depot.

item.title: BYD plots to overtake Tesla in Europe by 2030
item.description: BYD's Europe managing director plans to get around looming tariffs by building the ultra-cheap EVs on the continent.

item.title: Russia Mounting New Border Assaults in North, Ukraine Says
item.description: Armored columns tried to punch through at several points, the military said, raising pressure on already stretched Ukrainian forces.

item.title: Russia Mounting New Border Assaults in North, Ukraine Says
item.description: Armored columns tried to punch through at several points, the military said, raising pressure on already stretched Ukrainian forces.

item.title: Why a $3 billion software firm is betting on a flexible-work future—'the focus for us is carrot, not stick'
item.description: Sarah Franklin, a 15-year Salesforce alum, helms Lattice with the best of her former boss’ flexibility practices close at hand.

item.title: Inside Biden’s Broken Relationship With Muslim and Arab American Leaders
item.description: Even as the president piles new pressure on Israel to end the war in Gaza, those who have called most passionately for him to change course say it is too little, too late.

item.title: U.S. Ship Carrying Aid for Gaza Departs From Cyprus
item.description: A Pentagon spokesman said bad weather had made it impossible to install a new floating pier and causeway.

item.title: Upgrade OneCard: An All-Hassle Rewards Card
item.description: The Upgrade OneCard offers great rewards, but you have to jump through a lot of hoops to get them.
